strategy: Use LightGBMClassifier from lightgbm with the following settings: n_estimators=100, max_depth=7, learning_rate=0.1, num_leaves=31. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median and use LabelEncoder for categorical columns. Do not use get_dummies. Ensure all categorical features are cast to string before encoding.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from lightgbm import LGBMClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then encode
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Encode categorical features using LabelEncoder
label_encoders = {}
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        le = LabelEncoder()
        X_train[col] = le.fit_transform(X_train[col])
        X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])
        label_encoders[col] = le

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMClassifier(n_estimators=100, max_depth=7, learning_rate=0.1, num_leaves=31, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from lightgbm import LGBMClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then encode
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Encode categorical features using LabelEncoder
label_encoders = {}
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        le = LabelEncoder()
        # Fit on training data only (including NaN handled as 'Unknown')
        le.fit(X_train[col])
        X_train[col] = le.transform(X_train[col])
        X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])
        label_encoders[col] = le

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMClassifier(n_estimators=100, max_depth=7, learning_rate=0.1, num_leaves=31, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from lightgbm import LGBMClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then encode
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']

# Preprocess categorical features
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        # Fill NaN with 'Unknown' and convert to string
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Encode categorical features using LabelEncoder (fit only on training data)
label_encoders = {}
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        le = LabelEncoder()
        # Fit on training data only
        le.fit(X_train[col])
        X_train[col] = le.transform(X_train[col])
        X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])
        label_encoders[col] = le

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMClassifier(n_estimators=100, max_depth=7, learning_rate=0.1, num_leaves=31, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from lightgbm import LGBMClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then encode
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']

# Preprocess categorical features
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        # Fill NaN with 'Unknown' and convert to string
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Encode categorical features using LabelEncoder (fit only on training data)
label_encoders = {}
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        le = LabelEncoder()
        # Fit on training data only (including 'Unknown')
        le.fit(X_train[col])
        X_train[col] = le.transform(X_train[col])
        X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])
        label_encoders[col] = le

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMClassifier(n_estimators=100, max_depth=7, learning_rate=0.1, num_leaves=31, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from lightgbm import LGBMClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then encode
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']

# Preprocess categorical features
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        # Fill NaN with 'Unknown' and convert to string
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Encode categorical features using LabelEncoder (fit only on training data)
label_encoders = {}
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        le = LabelEncoder()
        # Fit on training data only (including 'Unknown')
        le.fit(X_train[col])
        X_train[col] = le.transform(X_train[col])
        X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])
        label_encoders[col] = le

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMClassifier(n_estimators=100, max_depth=7, learning_rate=0.1, num_leaves=31, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import numpy as np
from lightgbm import LGBMClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then encode

# Preprocess categorical features
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        # Fill NaN with 'Unknown' and convert to string
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Encode categorical features using LabelEncoder (fit only on training data)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from lightgbm import LGBMClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then encode
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']

# Preprocess categorical features
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        # Fill NaN with 'Unknown' and convert to string
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Encode categorical features using LabelEncoder (fit only on training data)
label_encoders = {}
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        le = LabelEncoder()
        # Fit on training data only (including 'Unknown')
        le.fit(X_train[col])
        X_train[col] = le.transform(X_train[col])
        X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])
        label_encoders[col] = le

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMClassifier(n_estimators=100, max_depth=7, learning_rate=0.1, num_leaves=31, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from lightgbm import LGBMClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then encode only for relevant features
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked']

# Preprocess categorical features
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        # Fill NaN with 'Unknown' and convert to string
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Encode categorical features using LabelEncoder (fit only on training data)
label_encoders = {}
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        le = LabelEncoder()
        # Fit on training data only (including 'Unknown')
        le.fit(X_train[col])
        X_train[col] = le.transform(X_train[col])
        X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])
        label_encoders[col] = le

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMClassifier(n_estimators=100, max_depth=7, learning_rate=0.1, num_leaves=31, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
